name: SPI Bug
short_description:
The Serial Peripheral Interface or SPI (pronounced "spy") bus is a synchronous serial data link used for connecting micro controllers to all kinds of peripheral devices, such as Flash memory, digital-to-analog and analog-to-digital converters, chip radios, etc. using only four wires.

The SPIBUG is a simple, yet flexible SPI host adapter that allows connecting a personal computer to the SPI bus. It makes it possible to program SPI devices in scripting languages (e.g. Python or Tcl) and can be used for rapid software prototyping, troubleshooting and debugging.

The SPIBUG runs on the very inexpensive off-the-shelf hardware, such as the MSP430 LaunchPad evaluation board available from Texas Instruments for measly $4.30. That's less than a price of a Big Mac and a Coke!

The SPIBUG is extensible. Support for other serial protocols, such as I2C and UART is planned in future releases.
summary: SPI bus diagnostics and debugging tool for the price of Big Mac
